db:abstract.db:para: The QMessageAuthenticationCode class provides a way to generate hash-based message authentication codes.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Use the QMessageAuthenticationCode class to generate hash-based message authentication codes (HMACs). The class supports all cryptographic hash algorithms from QCryptographicHash (see also QCryptographicHash::Algorithm).

To generate a message authentication code, pass a suitable hash algorithm and secret key to the constructor. Then process the message data by calling addData() one or more times. After the full message has been processed, get the final authentication code via the result() function:
For simple cases like above, you can also use the static hash() function:

db:note.db:para: The cryptographic strength of the HMAC depends upon the size of the secret key, and the security of the underlying hash function.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QMessageAuthenticationCode::QMessageAuthenticationCode(QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method, QByteArrayView key = {})
db:section.db:para: Constructs an object that can be used to create a cryptographic hash from data using method method and key key.

db:note.db:para: In Qt versions prior to 6.6, this function took its arguments as QByteArray, not QByteArrayView. If you experience compile errors, it's because your code is passing objects that are implicitly convertible to QByteArray, but not QByteArrayView. Wrap the corresponding argument in QByteArray{~~~} to make the cast explicit. This is backwards-compatible with old Qt versions.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] QMessageAuthenticationCode::QMessageAuthenticationCode(QMessageAuthenticationCode &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a new QMessageAuthenticationCode from other.

db:note.db:para: The moved-from object other is placed in a partially-formed state, in which the only valid operations are destruction and assignment of a new object.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: QMessageAuthenticationCode::~QMessageAuthenticationCode()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the object.

db:section.db:title: void QMessageAuthenticationCode::addData(const char *data, qsizetype length)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Adds the first length chars of data to the message.

db:section.db:title: bool QMessageAuthenticationCode::addData(QIODevice *device)
db:section.db:para: Reads the data from the open QIODevice device until it ends and adds it to message. Returns true if reading was successful.

db:section.db:para: Returns the authentication code for the message message using the key key and the method method.

db:section.db:title: void QMessageAuthenticationCode::reset()
db:section.db:para: Resets message data. Calling this function doesn't affect the key.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QMessageAuthenticationCode::result() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the final authentication code.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] QByteArrayView QMessageAuthenticationCode::resultView() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the final hash value.
Note that the returned view remains valid only as long as the QMessageAuthenticationCode object is not modified by other means.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.6] void QMessageAuthenticationCode::swap(QMessageAuthenticationCode &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps message authentication code other with this message authentication code. This operation is very fast and never fails.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.
